properties.areaDesc: San Francisco River Valley; South Central Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Upper Tularosa Valley; Chaves County Plains; Southwest Chaves County; Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 2 at 3:01PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
A low pressure system, currently near the Gulf of California, will
slowly track to the east over Old Mexico through Wednesday. This
will spread precipitation over the Land of Enchantment, mostly
during the day Tuesday through Tuesday night and Wednesday before
ending that afternoon. Snow levels will be quite high with this
storm system, with any appreciable snow accumulations generally
staying above 8,000 feet during the day Tuesday before lowering to
6,000 to 7,000 feet Tuesday night. While the high peaks near
Sierra Blanca might receive several inches of accumulations,
periods of rain and occasional modest snow amounts of just a few
inches are expected in Ruidoso. Scattered to widespread areas of
rainfall are then expected in the lower elevations, particularly
the plains of Chaves county where some locations may exceed an
inch of rainfall.

Anyone planning travel in southern New Mexico Tuesday through
Wednesday should be prepared for potential adverse weather
conditions. In the high elevations, icy or snow-covered roads and
low visibility in fog and snow may exist. Monitor NOAA weather
radio, weather.gov/abq or your local media for the latest weather
updates. For the latest New Mexico road conditions visit
nmroads.com or call 5-1-1.

NWSheadline: INCREASED RAIN AND HIGH ELEVATION SNOW EXPECTED FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY
